thread.title: Malloy: State tourism numbers up 5 percent from last year
thread.title_full: Malloy: State tourism numbers up 5 percent from last year

author: Adam Benson The Bulletin
title: Malloy: State tourism numbers up 5 percent from last year
text: MYSTIC - Gov. Dannel P. Malloy on Wednesday visited Mystic Aquarium in the lead up to Labor Day weekend to announce that attendance rates at 23 of the state's largest attractions rose 5.1 percent from this time last year. "Even without a bad winter, that would be impressive," Malloy said at a press conference. He also said hotel occupancy rates in southeastern Connecticut jumped by 9 percent - five times the national average. Malloy touted the state's $11 million advertising budget being used to market in surrounding states as a reason the the uptick. By Adam Benson The Bulletin The Bulletin By Adam Benson The Bulletin Posted Sep. 2, 2015 at 12:05 PM Updated at 1:43 PM
